aboutChakravyuha.title: ABOUT CHAKRAVYUHA
aboutChakravyuha.description: Chakravyuha symbolizes the fusion of intricate strategy, intelligence, and innovation—qualities that define both ancient warfare and modern technology. In the Mahabharata, only the most skilled and strategic minds could navigate this formation, and today's tech landscape is no different. To thrive, one must embrace adaptability, problem-solving, and futuristic thinking.
aboutChakravyuha.description2: Just like the interwoven layers of the Chakravyuha, today's world is built on the seamless integration of robotics, IoT, AI, software engineering, and entrepreneurship—each a vital component in shaping the next era of technological breakthroughs.
aboutChakravyuha.description3: Chakravyuha'26 is a two-day fest where all technical clubs of MIT come together to host a dynamic lineup of events, workshops, and competitions—challenging minds, fostering collaboration, and pushing the boundaries of innovation.

aboutMIT.title: ABOUT MIT
aboutMIT.description: Madras Institute of Technology (MIT), a constituent college of Anna University, is one of the premier technical institutions in India. Established in 1949, MIT has been a pioneer in engineering education with a rich legacy of producing industry leaders, entrepreneurs, and innovators.
aboutMIT.description2: Located in Chromepet, Chennai, the campus spans over 640 acres and houses state-of-the-art laboratories, research centers, and innovation hubs. MIT offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs across various engineering disciplines.
highlights: Ranked among top engineering colleges in Tamil Nadu
Home to 12+ technical clubs and student chapters
Strong industry partnerships and placement record
Active research in AI, Robotics, IoT, and emerging technologies

items.question: Who can participate in Chakravyuha '26?
items.answer: Chakravyuha '26 is open to all college students across India. Both undergraduate and postgraduate students can participate. Some events may have specific eligibility criteria mentioned in their descriptions.

items.question: How do I register for events?
items.answer: You can register for events by purchasing an Event Pass from our website. Choose from Bronze, Silver, or Gold passes based on the events you want to participate in. Individual event registrations are also available for select events.

items.question: Is accommodation provided for outstation participants?
items.answer: Limited accommodation is available for outstation participants on a first-come, first-served basis. Gold Pass holders get priority for accommodation assistance. Please register early and contact our coordinators for arrangements.

items.question: What should I bring to the fest?
items.answer: Participants must carry their valid college ID card, registration confirmation, and any event-specific materials mentioned in the event description. Laptops are required for hackathons and coding events.

items.question: Are there any cash prizes?
items.answer: Yes! Chakravyuha '26 features a prize pool of ₹5,00,000+ across all events. Individual event prizes range from ₹5,000 to ₹50,000. Hackathons and signature events have the highest prize pools.

items.question: How do I reach MIT Campus?
items.answer: MIT Campus is located in Chromepet, Chennai. The nearest railway station is Tambaram, from where free shuttle buses will operate during the fest. The campus is also accessible via Chennai Metro (Chromepet station).

items.question: Can I participate in multiple events?
items.answer: Yes, you can participate in multiple events as long as they don't have overlapping schedules. We recommend checking the event schedule before registering for multiple events.

items.question: Will certificates be provided?
items.answer: Yes, all participants will receive digital participation certificates. Winners will receive special winner certificates along with their prizes.
